meanings.definition: To breathe noisily through the nose due to a cold or congestion.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was snuffling because his nose was stuffed up.
meanings.sent2: She was snuffling all night because of her cold.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's snuffling made everyone giggle during the sad movie.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine was snuffling like a tired bear waking up from hibernation.
meanings.sent5: The sound of snuffling echoed through the quiet room, breaking the silence.

meanings.definition: The act of sniffing or sniffling, especially audibly.
meanings.sent1: The dog's snuffling was loud enough to wake up the whole house.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the snuffling of the raccoon outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The snuffling of the baby was so cute, it sounded like a tiny trumpet.
meanings.sent4: The forest was filled with the snuffling of curious animals exploring.
meanings.sent5: The snuffling of the bear searching for food was a warning to stay away.

meanings.definition: Making a snuffling sound while crying or sobbing.
meanings.sent1: She was snuffling as she tried to hold back her tears.
meanings.sent2: The child was snuffling softly, trying not to disturb anyone.
meanings.sent3: His snuffling during the sad movie made his friends tease him gently.
meanings.sent4: The wind outside was snuffling like a ghostly presence in the night.
meanings.sent5: The snuffling of the wind through the trees added an eerie atmosphere to the scene.
